entities.name: nurmengard
entities.description: Nurmengard is described as a prison built by Grindelwald to hold his opponents. It is also mentioned that Dumbledore ended up in there himself.

entities.name: grindelwald
entities.description: Grindelwald is described as the one who built Nurmengard and was caught by Dumbledore. He is also mentioned to have risen to power with the help of Dumbledore's ideas.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is described as the one who caught Grindelwald and ended up in Nurmengard. His ideas are also mentioned to have helped Grindelwald rise to power.

entities.name: rita
entities.description: Rita is mentioned as someone who can't pretend that Dumbledore and Grindelwald knew each other for more than a few months when they were young.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as the one who says 'They were young' in response to Rita's statement.

entities.name: muggles
entities.description: Muggles are mentioned as the ones over whom Grindelwald and Dumbledore plotted their rise to power.

relationships.description: Grindelwald built Nurmengard as a prison to hold his opponents.
Dumbledore caught Grindelwald and ended up in Nurmengard.
Dumbledore's ideas helped Grindelwald rise to power.
Rita knew Dumbledore for a few months when they were young.
Harry responded to Rita's statement by saying 'They were young'.
Grindelwald and Dumbledore plotted their rise to power over the Muggles.
